page.title: 01Dedham position - history
page.content:
DEDHAM
Dedham,in Essex,is a village of 1600 inhabitants.It is situated 8 miles North East of Colchester and 10 miles South West of Ipswich,near the A12 trunk road,close to the River Stour, the boundary between Essex and Suffolk. During the 15th and 16th centuries the flourishing wool trade in East Anglia made Dedham one of the wealthiest villages in the area. There are still traces of the wool trade in several local houses. Southfields is a unique example of a weavers house and factory. The Church was built with money from the wool trade. John Constable made Dedham famous in his paintings. The village's connection with painting continued into the present century when Sir Alfred Munnings lived in the village.
